item.title: Solving the Multiple Choice Knapsack Problem
item.description: The 0-1 Knapsack problem is a popular combinatorial optimization problem: Given a set of n items, each having a value \( p_i \) and a weight of \( w_i \), find a subset of these items such that the total value is maximized, while keeping the total weight of the items under a given constant weight capacity W. Formally, we need to maximize \( \sum_{i=1}^{n}{p_{i}f_{i}} \), while subjecting to \( \sum_{i=1}^{n}{w_{i}f_{i}} \le W \), \( f_i \in \{0, 1\}, \forall i \in \{ 1, …, n\} \).
